metadata.feature_description: Provides multi-language support for search crawler administration.

steps.action: Navigate to Site Settings > Search > Basic Settings tab
steps.expected: Search settings page loads with localized labels in English
steps.actual: Search settings page loaded successfully with all UI labels displayed in English including: Minimum Word Length, Maximum Word Length, Maximum Result Per Page, Custom Analyzer Type, Enable Partial-Word Search, SEARCH PRIORITIES, Title Boost, Tag Boost, Content Boost, Description Boost

steps.action: Navigate to Crawling tab to view more localized labels
steps.expected: Crawling tab displays localized section headers and column labels
steps.actual: Crawling tab loaded with localized labels: URL PATHS, URL, ENABLE SPIDERING, DNN IMPERSONATION, WINDOWS AUTH, Duplicates, Description, Regex Pattern, Included Directories, Excluded Directories

steps.action: Navigate to File Extensions tab and verify resource strings are loaded
steps.expected: Labels from SharedResources.resx file are displayed correctly
steps.actual: File Extensions tab loaded with localized labels from resource files: INCLUDED FILE EXTENSIONS, FILE EXTENSION, FILE TYPE, CONTENT CRAWLING, EXCLUDED FILE EXTENSIONS, Add File Type. Tooltip 'Content crawling is unavailable' matches tooltipContentCrawlingUnavailable.Text from SharedResources.resx

steps.action: Click on German language flag in the persona bar language selector
steps.expected: Admin UI falls back to English since German translations are not available for Search Crawler admin resources
steps.actual: After clicking German flag, the admin UI correctly remains in English. All labels continue to display in English (INCLUDED FILE EXTENSIONS, FILE EXTENSION, FILE TYPE, etc.), demonstrating proper fallback behavior to the default language when translations are unavailable

observations: The LocalizationHelper.cs class wraps DNN's Localization.GetString() method to retrieve localized strings from DesktopModules/DNNCorp/SearchCrawler/App_LocalResources/CrawlerSettings.ascx.resx
SharedResources.resx contains localized strings for error messages, log messages, tooltips, and UI labels used throughout the Search Crawler module
The localization system correctly falls back to the default English language when translations for other languages (e.g., German) are not available
Resource strings like 'Content crawling is unavailable' (tooltipContentCrawlingUnavailable.Text) are properly loaded and displayed in the UI
The admin persona bar provides language switching functionality, but Search Crawler admin resources only have English translations
